Reviews.Title: “A hotel in progress - will soon be a Marriott Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Bookistan5
Reviews.Content: A top to bottom renovation is nearly complete at the Excelsior and it will become a Marriott Courtyard as of Feb. 1 2006 or thereabouts. Some of the things I have to say about the hotel may soon be irrelevant. But for now - a nice, moderately priced hotel for business travelers in a good location, away from the tourist hustle bustle but still convenient to the Condado and Old San Juan. I stayed in room 905 which I think is one of the best lines (ie, rooms ending in 05) - they are quite a bit larger than most other rooms, and the other large rooms are close the elevator which is pretty noisy. The room has new, fairly attractive furniture but without any bells and whistles (see pictures). It was comfortable, clean, quiet, and had a nice view of the lagoon and the Condado. The hotel has 2 restaurants - Augusto's which is an expensive European restaurant which gets good reviews and which I did not try, and a more casual French bistro right off the lobby that has an authentic bistro menu and quite good food. However, breakfast served in the bistro was quite basic and service left ALOT to be desired. Upon entering in the morning on 2 of 4 mornings, tables from the night before had not been cleared and it took a while just to get a table. The continental breakfast was either 2 pieces of toast or a few slices from a baguette with toast and jam, plus coffee and juice. I was surprised by the few choices for breakfast, and especially, by the somewhat surly service. That was my biggest gripe about the hotel. Otherwise, the service was good and staff friendly. My room came with few amenities - there were a couple of bars of soap in the bathroom but no shampoos, shower caps, writing pads, etc. I imagine this will all change once the Marriott imprimatur is complete. I also noticed a couple of small shops about to open. There is also free Wi-Fi in the lobby. While I was there, the gym and the business center were both undergoing renovation and were closed. I did take a look at the pool which was small and hemmed in by walls - not very inviting and I would not come here with children as a result. The street is on a humdrum busines strip close to a few fast food restaurants, a Marshall's, the post office, and a bank. Besides the fast food joints, I did not see other nice dining options that were walking distance, but cabs are always parked outside the hotel. All in all, a decent, professionally run place and obviously getting better. I'd stay again if business brought me to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: patsyterrell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 404 of the Excelsior on Tuesday, July 12 and Wednesday, July 13, 2005. The Excelsior Hotel in San Juan Puerto Rico is continually recommended as a business class hotel. Reviews written by people who've stayed there were useless because they were so conflicting. Why no one has taken the very simple step of taking a few snap shots so people can just for themselves, I don't know. But, here they are. I have posted more on my personal site http://www.patsyterrell.com/excelsior/index.htm. My own assessment is that if you're a Cruise Ship person - meaning you want that level of accomodation, then hell no you're not going to be happy here. If you're a traveler who expects what you pay for, then you'll be happy here. It's basic, but clean and OK. It has the "niceties" you expect from a more upscale hotel, but it's a bit worn around the edges. The carpet needs to be replaced. It could stand some updating. But the bed was firm and clean. The bathroom was clean. The air-conditioning was cold and the water hot. The walls were paper thin and that would have been a problem if I'd had noisy neighbors but I was fortunate. And, to top it off, if you're planning to stay there for a vacation, you can walk a very easy block and a half and you're at a bus stop. For a quarter on the A5 or fifty cents on the Express Bus 1, you can go to Old San Juan and be there in about 5 minutes. There has been much mention of the construction noise. Yes, there's construction. Yes, construction makes noise. I'm not sure what you would expect the hotel to do about it. I was there two mornings - one morning construction started about 9 and the noisy part ended about 11. The next morning there was no construction noise as they were doing other things. The staff is excellent! Very helpful. Augusto's restaurant, on premises, and supposedly one of the best on the island, has excellent food but - like most such places for me - overpriced and pretentious. I guess I just don't like paying to have my --- kissed. I'd rather pay 2/3 as much and have "normal" - not "--- kissing included" service. I didn't go to the pool so can't speak about that. The location seems wonderful to me and location is what I'm generally after. I left here and went to the Westin Rio Mar near the rain forest for a convention. It is very upscale, 27 acres with private beach, more than twice the price, and I felt like a prisoner - nowhere to eat except on their site, a taxi ride to the town of San Juan was about $60 and took an hour. So, it all boils down to what kind of travel you like. But don't think you're getting a resort experience for $80 a night. Please. Get real. But, at least you can see for yourself what the Excelsior looks like and make your own decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chillaxing
Reviews.Content: Good if all you want is a room to sleep in. Clean. Maids very helpful and courteous. Front desk people very friendly and helpful, but you may have to wait a while to speak with them. Hotel is (still) under construction. There is no parking lot. I parked my rental car (a Hyundai Brio) on a street around the corner for a week and had no problems. Bus stop near hotel goes straight to Old San Juan. Not many places to eat early or late in the day - only one 24 hour bar several blocks away. Is near some daytime eateries - Subway, Chinese, Pizza.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay at outskirt of town”
Reviews.Author: yolkietoby
Reviews.Content: after reading all the negative reviews, I was afraid it's gonna be a real dump. However, given most of our time will be spent driving out of san juan, the location of this hotel seems to make sense compared to something in OSJ or condado and the price seems much lower to comparable places. We took a risk and we found the place sufficient for our need. rooms are clean, lobby is barren but the clean, white fluorescent lighting seems refreshing compared to other yellowish moody woody lobbies. A/C is quiet and cold. The hotel is surely nothing fancy but we don't care for that. the construction thing going on next door is not an issue at all. best thing of all is its proximity to highways going out to other parts of PR and you don't have to fight the traffic thru OSJ or condado every day and night. If I go back to SJ, I will not hesitate to stay there again. I would have give it a 3-star but given the many bad reviews here which I don't think really reflect the state the hotel is in, I am giving a 4 to counterbalance a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Compassionate People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to make an emergency trip to the island to attend a death in the family. We stayed at the Excelsior from June 2 until today, June 6. My husband recently had eye surgery and needed medication that the local Walgreens did not have. The only place where my husband felt he could get help was at the Veterans Hospital, since he has a service connected problem. We did not know how to get there, and one night one of the valets escorted us to the hospital front door. We will be forever grateful to these people for being compassionate enough to assist us in our time of need. As for the awful reviews some people gave, I would suggest that anyone who wants the services of a resort, should go to one and play the casinos, gorge on food and drink, be pampered, and pay the outrageous prices these fancy 5 star hotels charge. Our room was clean, the staff was friendly and the location is excellent with easy access to the major roads. The construction taking place is for a multistory apartment complex, and that takes a little time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that does not mind a place that's not a luxury hotel. BTW, The food at the restaurant is very good, although a little pricey. The place was packed the night we went there. It looked like a place that some of the local people who have cash to spend hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Over 25 years”
Reviews.Author: taina
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at this hotel each time we visit PR for one or two nights before heading into the island. We have been staying there for over twenty five years. We have stayed at several other hotels in San Juan - El Convento, Hilton and etc. but always go back to Excelsior. The accomodations have changed with time ( the kitchenette suites are smaller and you can't cook in the room anymore), but the main features have stayed the same. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. The staff is unobtrusive, but helpful when needed. The restaurants are ok if you don't want to leave the premises, but we prefer to find restaurants with local flavor. The hotel is located in a mixed business and residential area. They have on site parking and nearby bus service. The view of the laguna from the higher floors is stunning. We highly recommend the Excelsior to anyone who doesn't want to stay at a touristy type place and desires convenience, peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were afraid to go there after we read the reviews. To our surpise it wasn't so bad at all. The area is not bad, the hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good $, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to go there after I read all the bad comments here, but happily I found the opposite. It was easy to find and is located in one of the main avenues of San Juan. It was clean and it had helpful friendly staff. The pool was very clean and a little small, but who goes to the caribbean to swim in a pool?? They have nicer hotels in the area like the Hilton and Windham, but you'll have to pay at least 3 times more than at the Excelsior. There are no ghettoes around like some said and it's a safe area. Now one thing, I criticize heavily those tourist who go to a place and don't get out of the hotel out of fear of someting bad happening. This hotel offers a great place to stay in a great island...go out and explore...go to the beach, el yunque, take a day and drive around the island, go eat to a local place, try to go to a local club of bar, go scuba diving. etc ect. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.....”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBride
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior from March 24-March 27 and I must say the reviews on this site where exactly what I experienced. The hotel is in the middle of MAJOR construction just as everyone warnsâ€¦.I couldnâ€™t even tell where was the entrance. The customer service was average. The room...well it was a room. The walls between the rooms are paper-thin. The guy next door's TV kept me up the first night, the second night it was the kids across the hall, and the third night it was the guy next door again except this time he kept flushing the toilet a dozen times. Considering the price of the hotel, it was not that bad. Forget about the pool. It is SO tiny. There is a bus stop not even 1 block away that will take you to Condado beach or Old San Juan for just 25 cents. Once you get to Old San Juan there is a trolley which will take you all around Old San Juan for FREE. I recommended renting a car and venturing away from San Juan. I visited El Yunque, Luquillo Beach, Fajardo, and Seven Seas. Beware when driving aroundâ€¦.the streets can be tricky and confusing. One wrong turn and it could take a while to figure your way back. I took another persons advice and I visited the facilities at the Caribe Hilton. We went unnoticed and relaxed on their hammocks and lounge chairs. There is also a Starbucks in their lobby! Overall it was an okay experience and recommend staying at the Excelsior if all you need is a bed to rest at night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about Hotel Excelsior, I began to worry. I got this hotel through Priceline, at $110.00 per night. Believe you me it's not worth $50.00 a night. Thankfully it was a pre-cruise (one night) hotel, March 19, 2005, unitl we sailed away into the sunset the next day. When we arrived at the hotel, I knew immediately that we were not in a good neighborhood. The hotel is a total mess with construction going on inside and outside. We waited about 20 minutes to check-in. The time was 2:40 P.M. Check-in time was 3:00 P.M. They would not allow us to check-in 20 minutes before the 3:00 P.M. check-in time. We wanted to have lunch, so we asked if they could hold our luggage until we came back from lunch, no problem there. Went to lunch, about a block away from the hotel, sleezy neighborhood. After lunch, we decided to go into a souveneir store that was about 2 doors away from "Subway", we had to be buzzed into the store, after being checked out by the lady behind the counter, now doesn't that tell you something? Went back to the hotel, now it's after 3:00 P.M. After waiting another 20 minutes to retrieve our luggage from the basement, we finally settled into the room. The room was clean. Check-out the next day was another disaster. After 3 phone calls to the front desk, it took one hour and five minutes for the bell guy to come and get our luggage. Don't waste your money on this place, stay at any other hotel. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Never again. The only thing good about this hotel was the French Bistro restaurant, excellent food. Ate there because we didn't want to venture out at night in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for the days that we stayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A couple of my friends and myself with my kids stayed at that Hotel on the 1st week of July of 2004. When we got there I was only thinking of the reviews and people concerns about this Hotel. Our first concern was where we're going to find a parking, cause there's no place for you to park the car! And we ask one of the guys that worked there and we told us that he will park the car for us, until we booked our room. When we got in the ladies in the front desk who took care of us were very friendly and helpful!!! I asked them to gives us a room away from the elevators, cause I read in a couple of reviews that they were complaining that the elevators makes too much noise....But of course I didn't mention that to them! So then, we were on our way to see the rooms. The rooms that we had one of them had a rug "which it was a plus for me", the other one had tiles and a small kitchen "which I didn't had but didn't care cause I wasn't planning to cook in there", both of them had a two Queen Beds, the room had already the air condition on "so it was nice and cool", the bathroom were clean and so was the entire room! So we were all thinking "Is not that bad so far..."Then we asked for extra towels and blankets and they provided that to us in a timely matter. The night came and there weren't people making noises. In the next morning I noticed that they were constructing a building or a parking lot next to the Hotel, but again I didn't here any loud noise or had any inconvenience... It was very good and the price was not that bad at all! To get the best price for that place go to hotels, that's where we found this place and very cheap!!! The beach is just a few miles away, restaurant are close, parks, gas station and a mini markets for your needs is around the corner from there! If you are looking for something "Fancy" or "Modern Rooms" then get something else, this place wouldn't be for you! But if you are just looking for a place to sleep, not to hang in there and really enjoy the beauty and adventures of Puerto Rico, then stay in there and you would feel comfortable! We all had a great experience and time on our stay at the Hotel Excelsior!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Place is a total mess. Construction going on, elevator not working, rooms not clean. Even the cabdriver who took us there just shook his head.

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was recently purchased and with new owners you could already see the changes being made. The end result is very promising so I encourage anyone who is looking for an economical hotel rate to check-in the Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews here and elsewhere, I was expecting the worst; booked it for the night before a cruise. It's true, there was construction all around, including the lobby, but the desk clerk and the bell person were very helpful and kind, which makes quite a difference. Also, the room was quite clean, complete with stove and refrigerator, which the bell person proudly displayed to us. I have stayed at 4 and 5 * hotels and know the difference, but I was quite pleased with this hotel, mostly due to the staff and the fact that the rooms were clean, unlike I had read on other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGreg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel is under construction, and there is a lot of debris around. There were always cabs available. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with giving local information. The area around the hotel is somewhat rundown. Would not recommend walking at night in the area. Also would not recommend traveling to PR on a holiday. The whole place shuts down about 6pm and finding food near the hotel is next to impossible. We walked approx 4 blocks to get to a store to buy snacks. The odor in the smoking room was that of a wet dog that had been smoking, but what do you expect for a smoking room. The non-smoking room was smaller but was nice enough. I think in a pinch I would stay here again. Got a good deal on the price online. I think it will be better when they are finally done with the construction. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unlike the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews but made my decision when i called directly. I took a risk although some reviews sounded like a house of horror. The hotel is still under construction which I was displeased. But i stayed for 4 days and loved it. The furniture is out dated but clean. I guess thats why their rates were so economical. But the money i saved was well spent on tours and pina coladas in Old San Juan. Which by the way for 50 cents a bus takes you straight to Old San Juan. Listen if you want a small cozy hotel this is where you want to be. The staff was wonderfull with my many requests & questions. My maid was unique she did not know english but we understood each other. Why have all these people had such horrid experiences? Thank god I decided to go anyway. I will be going back as soon as i recover $$$$$$.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the Internet do not do the hotel justice. Only one picture looked anywhere close of what the hotel look like (pool area). The rooms were filthy and no one mentioned the construction going on. I would not recommend this hotel to someone I disliked.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly terrible. The inside was dirty, we did not even want to sleep on the bed. The online pictures are misleading and it is way over priced. We actually left the next moring and checked into another hotel. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The outside looks like they are tearing it down! When our taxi pulled up, I said, Please tell me this is NOT our hotel. It looks awful. We stayed there Nov 2004 and the rennovation looks like it's been going on for years. The check-in process took forever even though there were only 2 people in line. Our room was nice, including a refrigerator and a microwave, but it's very hard to overcome the outward appearance and the old buildings torn down around the hotel. There is a busline out front that goes directly to old San Juan for $.50. The last bus back runs at 10:30pm so it's an inexpensive way to shop old San Juan, although the area around the hotel is a bit scrarey at night. For our next trip, I will select a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can not figure out how this hotel has a 3 star rating, half a star would be pushing it. The check-in desk employees were rude and the bell captain was not to be found. Our rooms were not ready and it took the bell captain 1 and half hours to find the time to check our luggage into storage until our rooms were ready. They wanted us to "just leave your luggage in the lobby until our room was ready". As we were attempting to check-in, three other couples where checking our early because of the condition of this hotel. With the construction going on everything is dirty, the table and chairs at the pool had to be cleaned before we could set down. They don't tell you about the construction on their website. The pictures shown on the website must be from another hotel, sure didn't see anything like them when we stayed there. Our reservations were for three nights, stayed one. Transferred to the Wyndman Condado for the remaining stay. I will never even give this hotel another look next time I am laying over in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Excelsior was a good middle-ground place to stay while we were seeing the sights in Old San Juan. It is just down the block from a bus stop that takes you right into the city for 25 cents. The hotel itself is fairly clean, in a pretty respectable area of town. It's not on the water by any means, but it is a good place to sleep at night while touring the area of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read the reviews first!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I have to say I wish I had read the reviews before I booked this hotel. 1. There is no where to park and they have the nerve to charge $12 a day for parking! 2. The pool is so small 10 people couldn't fit. 3. The lady at the desk was so nasty!! 4. They put so much luggage and people on the elevator at the same time that the elevator collaped!!! People were trapped 10 to be exact! They came out with blood on there cloths, the mirrors in the elevtor shattered on them!! The rooms do not by any means look like they do on there website. The rugs were disgusting, stains everywhere the furniture is old. They say you have coffee and tea in the room COMPLEMENTRY!!! No way I called the front desk and was tod they don't have any but I could call room service??? Or go to the resturant??? All I can say it you pay for what you get and you live and learn. I had my mother with me and she was asked to get out of the elevator so that they good bring up someone elses luggage to them? Have you ever???? OH AND BY THE WAY!!! The construction is unbelieveable!!! BEWARE OF THIS PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was truly awful. I got into town in the evening; tired and needing a shower. Not only was the bathroom filthy (the floor and the toilet looked like they had not been cleaned in months), but the hotel did not even provide a bar of soap! Thankfully, I carry my own soap when I travel! I was told there was room service, but there were no menu's in the room. I am surprised that they provided towels. I honestly wish I would have spent a few extra dollars to stay somewhere more decent. It is a sad state of affairs to spend $100 for a lousy place like this. A very creepy place.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt Reccomend it at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March of 2004, I hadnt been back to PR for 19yrs. When i got in this room i was kinda thrown back. It was worse than a Motel 6 Motel. I wouldnt even rate this a hotel I would consider it a Motel. The Iron and Board are down the hall in a hall closet and that dont even work. I called the Hotel today Aug 9, 2004. I talked to the manager about my experience to see if the hotel changed any, she recommended another hotel. I told her the ceiling that was crumbling in the bathroom and the A/C did not work. She told me that she thinks her hotel was nice. I asked about the falling ceiling she once again recommended Hotel Miramar. I asked "Your not even recommending your own Hotel" she replied, there are a lot of hotels here in San Juan. So go figure, If you stay you wont be happy for the price thats for sure. Just my own opininon and I think it gives San Juan a bad impression on peoples perception of our beautiful Island of Enchantment. Puerto Rico itself is way worth the trip. Im returning to the Island again and definetly will be staying at a Wyndham resort for a $20 difference. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Hotel Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After all that I had read, I was quite suprized by friendly professional courteous staff, clean rooms, maid service everyday... Need I say more. We had an awesome time and would reccommend this hotel for those family oriented vacations. Not alot of "hoopla" around the Hotel- Quiet and peaceful. Pool was also very well kept and we enjoyed out stay. Thumbs up for Hotel Excelsior!
